To execute on the first feature, which is enabling businesses to pay their employees in cryptocurrency and manage their payroll using LumenPay, you could follow these steps:

1. Research and development: Start by conducting thorough research on the needs of businesses that pay their employees in cryptocurrency, and on the current offerings of other payroll platforms in this space. Use this research to identify gaps and opportunities, and to develop a product roadmap for LumenPay.
2. Build the platform: Use the product roadmap to guide the development of the platform, focusing on building the core features and functionality that businesses need to pay their employees in cryptocurrency and manage their payroll. This may involve building features for creating and managing employee wallets, making bulk payments, tracking employee pay and benefits, and managing tax compliance.
3. Test and refine the platform: Once the platform is developed, conduct thorough testing to ensure that it is reliable and user-friendly. Use feedback from testers to iterate on the product and make improvements as needed.
4. Launch the platform: Once the platform is ready, launch it and begin on-boarding businesses to use it. Use marketing and outreach efforts to create awareness about the platform and to attract new users.
